Question: At the time, this person was variously billed as "The King of Western Bop", "The Hillbilly Cat", and "The Memphis Flash".
Hints: The Jordanaires sang harmony, as they had on The Steve Allen Show; they would work with this person through the 1960s.
On December 4, this person dropped into Sun Records where Carl Perkins and Jerry Lee Lewis were recording and jammed with them.
Elvis, this person's second album, was released in October and quickly rose to number one.
